ğŸš« Toxic Plants for Cats

âš ï¸ If your cat comes into contact with these plants, seek veterinary care immediately!
âŒ Highly toxic! Even small amounts can cause vomiting, kidney failure, or death
Plant NameCommon NameRisk Level
LilyLilyâš ï¸ Extremely dangerous to cats! All parts (flowers, leaves, pollen, water) can cause acute kidney failure

ğŸš¨ Emergency: If your cat contacts any of these plants, contact your veterinarian or pet poison control immediately!
ğŸ±
Aloe Vera
âš ï¸
While aloe gel is safe for human use, the latex (yellow sap near the leaf skin) contains saponins and anthraquinones that are toxic to cats. Ingestion can cause vomiting, diarrhea, and lethargy.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Carnations
âš ï¸
Carnations can cause mild gastrointestinal upset and skin irritation in cats. Theyâ€™re not life-threatening, but best kept away from curious kitties.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Chrysanthemums
âš ï¸
Chrysanthemums contain pyrethrins and sesquiterpene lactones that can cause vomiting, diarrhea, drooling, and even depression or incoordination in cats.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Daffodils
âš ï¸
Beloved spring flowers that can irritate a catâ€™s mouth and GI tract. Bulbs contain the highest toxin concentration; petals and leaves are less toxic but still irritating.
Explore â†’
ğŸŒ¿
ğŸ±
Lilies
âš ï¸
All parts of lilies are toxic to cats.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Monstera
âš ï¸
Contains insoluble calcium oxalate crystals that cause intense burning and irritation of the mouth, tongue, and lips in cats. While rarely fatal, it causes significant discomfort.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Oleander
âŒ
All parts contain cardiac glycosides extremely toxic to cats. Ingestion may cause severe heart problems, digestive upset, and can be fatal.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Peace Lily
âš ï¸
Despite its name, the Peace Lily is NOT a true lily (Lilium) and does not cause kidney failure. However, it contains calcium oxalate crystals that irritate the mouth and digestive tract.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Philodendron
âš ï¸
Contains insoluble calcium oxalate crystals that cause intense burning, drooling, and swelling in a catâ€™s mouth and throat. Rarely fatal, but ingestion is extremely uncomfortable.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Pothos
âš ï¸
Contains calcium oxalate crystals that cause immediate burning and irritation in the mouth, lips, and tongue. Cats often chew it out of curiosity due to trailing vinesâ€”but even a small bite causes distress.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Sago Palm
âŒ
Every part is highly toxic to catsâ€”seeds (nuts) are most deadly. Even a single seed can cause severe liver failure, seizures, and death within 24â€“48 hours.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Snake Plant
âš ï¸
Snake plants contain saponins, which can cause nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea in cats. Most cases are mild, but ingestion should still be avoided.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
Tulips
âŒ
Tulips contain tulipalin A and B, which are most concentrated in the bulbs. Ingestion can cause drooling, vomiting, and diarrhea. Leaves and flowers are less toxic but still irritating.
Explore â†’
ğŸ±
ZZ Plant
âš ï¸
Popular easy-care indoor plant containing calcium oxalate crystals that can cause oral irritation and GI upset if ingested by cats.
Explore â†’
